tool.name: OSMGPAttributeSelector

param.name: in_osmfeatureclass
param.dialogReference: Input feature class from which the OSM tags are to be extracted.
param.pythonReference: Input feature class from which the OSM tags are to be extracted.

param.name: in_attributeselect
param.dialogReference: Select the OSM (OpenStreetMap) tag keys to extract from the tag collection and store as attributes in the feature class table.
param.pythonReference: Specify a list of OSM (OpenStreetMap) tag keys to extract from the tag collection and store as attributes in the feature class table.

tool.summary: The tool allows the user to extract OSM key from the tag collection and it stores them as standalone attributes in the provided feature class.
tool.usage: The tool allows the user to extract OSM key from the tag collection and it stores them as standalone attributes in the provided feature class.

scriptExample.title: OSM Attribute Selector Sample (Python)
scriptExample.para: This Python window sample demonstrates how to extract individual tags.
scriptExample.code:
# import the system modules import arcpy from arcpy import env
# load the OpenStreetMap specific toolbox arcpy.ImportToolbox(r'd:\projects\OSMEditor\WheelChairMap\OpenStreetMap Toolbox.tbx')
env.workspace = r'd:\projects\OSMEditor\WheelChairMap\defaultstorage.gdb'
# extract the name tag for all line features arcpy.OSMGPAttributeSelector_osmtools(r'stuttgart\stuttgart_osm_ln', 'name')
# filter the points to only process the attribute carrying nodes filteredPointLayer = 'Only attributed nodes' arcpy.MakeFeatureLayer_management(r'stuttgart\stuttgart_osm_pt', filteredPointLayer, "osmSupportingElement = 'no'")
# extract the name tag for the filtered point features arcpy.OSMGPAttributeSelector_osmtools(filteredPointLayer, 'name,note')

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The tool allows the user to extract OSM key from the tag collection and it stores them as standalone attributes in the provided feature class.
